channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump to meet with House Republicans to discuss Venezuela, other topics
item.description: President Trump is set to meet with House Republicans Tuesday. The meeting comes a day after administration officials briefed top lawmakers on the weekend operation in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is set to meet with House Republicans Tuesday. The meeting comes a day after administration officials briefed top lawmakers on the weekend operation in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Rep. Adam Smith shares what lawmakers have learned about U.S. actions in Venezuela
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel asks U.S. Representative Adam Smith, the top Democrat on the House Armed Services Committee, about what Congress is learning about the Trump administration's actions in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel asks U.S. Representative Adam Smith, the top Democrat on the House Armed Services Committee, about what Congress is learning about the Trump administration's actions in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Venezuelan authorities detain more than a dozen international journalists
item.description: Venezuelan authorities detained more than a dozen international journalists Monday, a media advocacy group says. Most of them have since been released, but the move has members of the press concerned.
item.content:encoded: Venezuelan authorities detained more than a dozen international journalists Monday, a media advocacy group says. Most of them have since been released, but the move has members of the press concerned.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Nicolas Maduro pleads not guilty in first court appearance, Trump to meet with House Republicans at Kennedy Center, U.S. health officials reduce the number of vaccines recommended for children.
item.content:encoded: Nicolas Maduro pleads not guilty in first court appearance, Trump to meet with House Republicans at Kennedy Center, U.S. health officials reduce the number of vaccines recommended for children.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Trump says the U.S. plans to "take back" Venezuela's oil. But what does that mean
item.description: President Trump says the U.S. will "take back" Venezuela's oil. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Jason Bordoff, founding director of Columbia University's Center on Global Energy Policy, about his remarks.
item.content:encoded: President Trump says the U.S. will "take back" Venezuela's oil. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Jason Bordoff, founding director of Columbia University's Center on Global Energy Policy, about his remarks.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Once an industry top dog, Intel hopes to regain dominance with chip made in the U.S.
item.description: Intel has announced the launch of a chip that's made in America. Analysts say the Core Ultra Series Three could help the California-based company regain its dominance in the chip industry.
item.content:encoded: Intel has announced the launch of a chip that's made in America. Analysts say the Core Ultra Series Three could help the California-based company regain its dominance in the chip industry.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: U.S. health officials reduce the number of vaccines recommended for all children
item.description: U.S. health officials have announced major changes to the childhood vaccine schedule, reducing the number of diseases children are routinely protected against from 17 to 11.
item.content:encoded: U.S. health officials have announced major changes to the childhood vaccine schedule, reducing the number of diseases children are routinely protected against from 17 to 11.
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz drops out of gubernatorial race
item.description: Minnesota's Democratic Gov. Tim Walz says he's dropping his bid for a third term. His decision comes amid criticism of his management of fraud investigations highlighted by President Trump,
item.content:encoded: Minnesota's Democratic Gov. Tim Walz says he's dropping his bid for a third term. His decision comes amid criticism of his management of fraud investigations highlighted by President Trump,
item.dc:creator: Clay Masters

item.title: Goddard Space Flight Center staff says library's closure degrades NASA's mission
item.description: The library at Goddard Space Flight Center in Maryland is closing after a number of disruptions and reductions by the Trump administration. Staff members say it's degrading NASA's mission.
item.content:encoded: The library at Goddard Space Flight Center in Maryland is closing after a number of disruptions and reductions by the Trump administration. Staff members say it's degrading NASA's mission.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Hegseth threatens Sen. Mark Kelly's military rank over 'illegal orders' video
item.description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth says he's begun the process of reducing the retirement pay and rank of Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly over a video Kelly did telling troops not to follow illegal orders.
item.content:encoded: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth says he's begun the process of reducing the retirement pay and rank of Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly over a video Kelly did telling troops not to follow illegal orders.
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence
